Name: Bohemian Martini
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Review: A regular Five-to-One Dry Martini garnished with a caperberry.
History: Created circa 2002 by Tim Stones and Ross Simon while bartending at LAB Bar on Old Compton Street in Soho, London, England. The name comes from Café Bohéme, the late-opening restaurant practically opposite, where the LAB crew would go for sustenance after a shift. Martini history
Nutrition: One serving of Bohemian Martini contains 183 calories
